notes.body: Hello Nimisha,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     This email is with regards to your order #656893703715725312-79273, We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you with your order.     As per update received from our team, please be informed that we have raised a return request for 01 quantity of the SEBAMED BABY LIP BALM|SOFT BABY LIPS|WITH SHEA BUTTER | JOJOBA OIL & BEESWAX|4.8 GM   on 15th December 2025. Please be informed, items being returned should be in their original manufacturer’s packaging with labels and barcode intact.     Please note that the medicine will be collected within 48 hours from the day the request is raised. Once the medicine is returned, it will be verified by our partner retailer at the store. The refund will be processed and initiated within 5 business days. Also, once the refund is initiated it would reflect in your source account within 7-10 business days.     We appreciate your patience in the meantime.     We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.     For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!     Regards,  PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Nimisha,

Greetings from PharmEasy!
 
This email is with regards to your order #656893703715725312-79273, We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you with your order.

As per update received from our team, please be informed that we have raised a return request for 01 quantity of the SEBAMED BABY LIP BALM|SOFT BABY LIPS|WITH SHEA BUTTER | JOJOBA OIL & BEESWAX|4.8 GM   on 15th December 2025. Please be informed, items being returned should be in their original manufacturer’s packaging with labels and barcode intact.
 
Please note that the medicine will be collected within 48 hours from the day the request is raised. Once the medicine is returned, it will be verified by our partner retailer at the store. The refund will be processed and initiated within 5 business days. Also, once the refund is initiated it would reflect in your source account within 7-10 business days.
 
We appreciate your patience in the meantime.
 
We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.
 
For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.
 
Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!
 
Regards,
PharmEasy

notes.body: Hello Samir,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     With regards to your order #657839235037728768-59107 as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.     As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 11th December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.      We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.     We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.     For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.      Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!     Regards,  PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Samir,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

With regards to your order #657839235037728768-59107 as checked due to some unforeseen circumstances, the order was not delivered to you by the expected date of delivery. Please accept my apologies for the same.

As per the records, your order is delivered to you on 11th December 2025. We have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future. 

We look forward to having an opportunity to serve you in the future.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

notes.body: Hello Thirupathi,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     I am sorry to hear that you wish to delete your account with PharmEasy. Please note that currently, we do not have a facility to delete the account from our database; however, we can deactivate your account. We will be unable to activate it later, and it will be deactivated permanently.     Once your request has been processed in the system, our agent will call within 24 to 48 hours on a registered mobile number and confirm if you have requested account deactivation. After verification, an OTP will be sent to your registered mobile number.  Once the OTP is verified, the agent will go ahead and deactivate your account    Kindly confirm so that we can proceed with the request.     Awaiting your earliest response.     Regards,  Habiba

Hello, 
   
 
 Greetings from PharmEasy!  
   
 I understand your concern is in regards to your order #633841392504913920-23610. As per the system, the order has been delivered to you on 6th October 2025. Any changes which need to be made to the invoice can be accepted within 30 days of the order delivery. Hence, we regret to inform you that we are unable to comply with your request to make the changes. 
   
 Please be informed for non-prescription medicines/products, the invoice is prepared as per the profile name mentioned at the time of placing the order. If the prescription is uploaded for non-prescription medicines/products, the invoice will be prepared as per the uploaded prescription.  
   
 For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels, on the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.  
   
  Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy. 
   
 Regards, 
 Sandhya Nackwal

notes.body:
I am not asking for any change - rather its a mistake by Pharmeasy - that needs to be corrected. How can you raise a medicine invoice on the name of a person without a doctor's prescription on his/her name? If you do not agree to correct this invoice I will raise it to concern medical body to ban you as you are delivering medicine without matching prescription, which is violation of guidelines by MCI. And on top of it when I am asking you to correct that you are taking a wrong position in treating it as any other request? It is your violation of guidelines that needs to be corrected not mine.

I am marking this to State Drug controller authority of Uttar Pradesh and Haryana for further action. 
Dear sir/madam (State Drug Controller Authority - UP, Haryana) : Please review the invoice attached and investigate on this as this is sold without proper prescription reference and Pharmeasy as per trailing email is denying to correct their mistake.

Regards,
Abhijat Dwivedi
(M)+919873919059

notes.body: Hello Manas,      Greetings from PharmEasy!     This email is in regards to your order #658033846991761408-59910. we are sorry to inform you that your order was cancelled on 13th December 2023 due to the medicine that you added were unavailable with our Partner Retailer.  We are sorry for the inconvenience caused to you.      Please note, at the time of placing the order the requested medicine was available in limited quantity and you were able to add medicines in the order. Once the medicine was added to your order our Partner Retailer tried to arrange the medicine from every possible source. However, they could not arrange one. We apologize that we were unable to fulfill your medicine requirements for this order completely.     We request you to place a new order after 7 days for the required medicine. As our retailer restock the medicines every 7 days. If the medicine is still unavailable, We would request you to reach us out. We will highlight your concern to the Partner retailer.     Also cancellation refund of Rs.247.94/- has been initiated on 13th December 2023 and same will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days.     Be rest assured as we have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future. Looking forward to delighting you soon.     We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.     For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels, on the App or website, listed in the "Need Help" section.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!     Regards,  PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Manas, 

Greetings from PharmEasy!

This email is in regards to your order #658033846991761408-59910. we are sorry to inform you that your order was cancelled on 13th December 2023 due to the medicine that you added were unavailable with our Partner Retailer.  We are sorry for the inconvenience caused to you. 

Please note, at the time of placing the order the requested medicine was available in limited quantity and you were able to add medicines in the order. Once the medicine was added to your order our Partner Retailer tried to arrange the medicine from every possible source. However, they could not arrange one. We apologize that we were unable to fulfill your medicine requirements for this order completely.

We request you to place a new order after 7 days for the required medicine. As our retailer restock the medicines every 7 days. If the medicine is still unavailable, We would request you to reach us out. We will highlight your concern to the Partner retailer.

Also cancellation refund of Rs.247.94/- has been initiated on 13th December 2023 and same will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days.

Be rest assured as we have jotted down the details of your experience and PharmEasy will ensure all appropriate actions are taken to prevent similar situations from happening in the future. Looking forward to delighting you soon.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels, on the App or website, listed in the "Need Help" section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!

Regards,
PharmEasy

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Dear Team,

This is absolutely unacceptable.

I placed an order for a Multivitamin Face Mask and the app clearly showed
the payable amount as ₹767. But when the order was delivered, I was
overcharged and forced to pay ₹825. This is nothing short of a scam.

Pics are attached.

To make it worse, instead of the face mask I ordered, you delivered a
Strengthening Hair Mask, which is a completely different product. This is
not just a mistake—this is negligence.


I raised a complaint immediately, No resolution, return arranged but no
update , no proper response. I had specifically ordered this item to gift
someone, and because of your team’s carelessness, the entire moment was
ruined.


I am deeply frustrated and extremely disappointed. I need strict action
taken immediately, including:


   1.

   Full refund for the overcharged amount
   2.

   Immediate pickup of the wrong product
   3.

   Compensation for the inconvenience and ruined occasion
   4.

   Clear explanation of how such errors and overcharging were allowed to
   happen


If this is not resolved on priority, I will make sure to take this matter
forward through every consumer platform available. After this experience, I
will never recommend your app to anyone.


*Reference No.: 22262419*


I expect a prompt response and resolution asap


Regards,

Pawan Kumar

Reg mo: 8802803244

--

notes.body: Hello Pawan,     Greetings from PharmEasy!  We understand your concern in regard to order #656214065571237888-40521.       As checked, the final billing amount for the order was Rs. 825.89, hence, the same was billed. You can refer to the invoice copy.      With regard to the wrong item received, we have highlighted your concern with our partner retailer. We will notify you once we get a further update. We apologise for the inconvenience caused to you. Your patience is highly appreciated.      In the meantime, please send us the images of the delivered item highlighting the PharmEasy barcode sticker (QR code sticker pasted on the product) and the batch number to investigate further. The attachment should be less than 20 MB.  Regards, PharmEasy

notes.body:
Hello Team,


Are you even serious about your job? From placing the order to requesting a
refund, it has been nearly 15 days — and all you have done is play with my
patience and emotions. My biggest mistake was trusting your app and
ordering from your platform.


I did everything correctly from my side. I paid the amount, you delivered
the wrong product, and since then I’ve been waiting endlessly for the
return and now another 5–7 days for the refund. This is completely
unacceptable.


What kind of scammers operate like this? I will surely highlight this
entire experience on social media to show people the level of “service” you
provide — ruining someone’s occasion, testing their patience, and proving
that online platforms like yours cannot be trusted.


To hell with your app and your services.

Br,

What kind of scammers operate like this? I will surely highlight this entire experience on social media to show people the level of “service” you provide — ruining someone’s occasion, testing their patience, and proving that online platforms like yours cannot be trusted.

To hell with your app and your services.

Br,

overcharged and forced to pay ₹825. This is nothing short of a scam.

To make it worse, instead of the face mask I ordered, you delivered a
Strengthening Hair Mask, which is a completely different product. This is
not just a mistake—this is negligence.


I raised a complaint immediately, No resolution, return arranged but no
update , no proper response. I had specifically ordered this item to gift
someone, and because of your team’s carelessness, the entire moment was
ruined.


I am deeply frustrated and extremely disappointed. I need strict action
taken immediately, including:

   Full refund for the overcharged amount
   2.

   Immediate pickup of the wrong product
   3.

   Compensation for the inconvenience and ruined occasion
   4.

   Clear explanation of how such errors and overcharging were allowed to
   happen


If this is not resolved on priority, I will make sure to take this matter
forward through every consumer platform available. After this experience, I
will never recommend your app to anyone.


*Reference No.: 22262419*


I expect a prompt response and resolution asap


Regards,

Pawan Kumar

helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
Dear Team,
This is absolutely unacceptable.
I placed an order for a Multivitamin Face Mask and the app clearly showed the payable amount as ₹767. But when the order was delivered, I was overcharged and forced to pay ₹825. This is nothing short of a scam.
Pics are attached.
To make it worse, instead of the face mask I ordered, you delivered a Strengthening Hair Mask, which is a completely different product. This is not just a mistake—this is negligence.

I raised a complaint immediately, No resolution, return arranged but no update , no proper response. I had specifically ordered this item to gift someone, and because of your team’s carelessness, the entire moment was ruined.

I am deeply frustrated and extremely disappointed. I need strict action taken immediately, including:
  1. Full refund for the overcharged amount
  2. Immediate pickup of the wrong product
  3. Compensation for the inconvenience and ruined occasion
  4. Clear explanation of how such errors and overcharging were allowed to happen

If this is not resolved on priority, I will make sure to take this matter forward through every consumer platform available. After this experience, I will never recommend your app to anyone.

Reference No.: 22262419

I expect a prompt response and resolution asap

Regards,
Pawan Kumar

Hello Shiddarth,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

This email is in regard to order #657647214948286464-46276.

We have received an update from our Logistics team that the order has been cancelled by you. A refund of Rs. 2200.48 is initiated to your account. Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this. A partial refund of Rs. 247.65 was initiated to your account on 10.12.2025.

We apologise for the inconvenience caused to you and hope to serve you better ahead.

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.

Regards,
PharmEasy

helpdesk_ticket.description:
Dear PharmEasy Customer Support Team,
Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

I am writing this email as a FINAL, URGENT, and HIGH-PRIORITY ESCALATION
regarding the severe mishandling and procedural lapses associated with my
order Order ID: 653726198280949760.

I request you to read this email completely and carefully, as every point
mentioned below is critical and requires immediate senior-level attention.


---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under the above-mentioned order ID.
However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items,

And both items were wrong/incorrect medicines,

The remaining 3 items were completely missing.


This is not a minor operational error. This is a serious breach of order
integrity, especially in the pharmaceutical industry where accuracy
directly affects customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed because your team reviewed only
the dispatch video and found no issue.

With due respect, I want to make it very clear that:

A dispatch-level video alone does NOT constitute a complete investigation.

A standard and fair investigation for missing or incorrect medicines must
include:

Review of CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Detailed chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparison at every point

Verification of movement and scan logs

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging or re-routing investigation


Closing a serious complaint based only on the dispatch video is
operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally
unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request PharmEasy to conduct a complete and transparent
chain-of-custody investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

You must review the CCTV footage of:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

Every transit and routing hub

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting area

Pick-up and handover section


B. Verification of Weight Logs

A detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at the origin

Weight during each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


Any mismatch will clearly show missing items.

C. Movement & Scan Audit

A full audit should include:

Outbound scan

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scan

Re-scan or re-routing logs



---

4. Request for Transparency – Provide Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that the relevant CCTV
footage, including:

Packing

Sorting

Hub movement

Delivery station handling


be shared with me for transparency, as I have every right to verify how my
parcel was handled at each stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving:

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of
the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

Provide all the correct medicines/products that I originally ordered.

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing
and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Initiating a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all hub CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability through internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety,
accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare
products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves
and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan

-- 


Disclaimer:

This email contains proprietary, business-confidential, 
and/or privileged material. The information contained in this e-mail is 
intended solely for the use of the individual to whom it is addressed. If 
you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any 
disclosure, copying, distribution or action in relation to the contents of 
this email is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful and request you to 
permanently delete this message and any attachments herein. You are 
requested to advise the sender, of your receipt of this email by return 
e-mail. The Company and its affiliates rule out any and every liability 
resulting from this or any other electronic transmission.

Merged from ticket 22273054

Subject: FINAL & MOST CRITICAL ESCALATION – Request for Complete Chain-of-Custody Audit, Full Multi-Hub CCTV Verification & Immediate Resolution | Order ID: 653726198280949760

Description:

Dear PharmEasy Customer Support Team,
Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

I am writing this email as a FINAL, URGENT, and HIGH-PRIORITY ESCALATION regarding the severe mishandling and procedural lapses associated with my order Order ID: 653726198280949760.

I request you to read this email completely and carefully, as every point mentioned below is critical and requires immediate senior-level attention.


---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under the above-mentioned order ID.
However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items,

And both items were wrong/incorrect medicines,

The remaining 3 items were completely missing.


This is not a minor operational error. This is a serious breach of order integrity, especially in the pharmaceutical industry where accuracy directly affects customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed because your team reviewed only the dispatch video and found no issue.

With due respect, I want to make it very clear that:

A dispatch-level video alone does NOT constitute a complete investigation.

A standard and fair investigation for missing or incorrect medicines must include:

Review of CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Detailed chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparison at every point

Verification of movement and scan logs

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging or re-routing investigation


Closing a serious complaint based only on the dispatch video is operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request PharmEasy to conduct a complete and transparent chain-of-custody investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

You must review the CCTV footage of:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

Every transit and routing hub

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting area

Pick-up and handover section


B. Verification of Weight Logs

A detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at the origin

Weight during each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


Any mismatch will clearly show missing items.

C. Movement & Scan Audit

A full audit should include:

Outbound scan

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scan

Re-scan or re-routing logs



---

4. Request for Transparency – Provide Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that the relevant CCTV footage, including:

Packing

Sorting

Hub movement

Delivery station handling


be shared with me for transparency, as I have every right to verify how my parcel was handled at each stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving:

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

Provide all the correct medicines/products that I originally ordered.

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Initiating a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all hub CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability through internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety, accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan 


Disclaimer:
This email contains proprietary, business-confidential, and/or privileged material. The information contained in this e-mail is intended solely for the use of the individual to whom it is addressed. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution or action in relation to the contents of this email is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful and request you to permanently delete this message and any attachments herein. You are requested to advise the sender, of your receipt of this email by return e-mail. The Company and its affiliates rule out any and every liability resulting from this or any other electronic transmission.

---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint

4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund

---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety, accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan

Merged from ticket 22273050

Subject: FINAL & MOST CRITICAL ESCALATION – Request for Complete Chain-of-Custody Audit, Full Multi-Hub CCTV Verification & Immediate Resolution | Order ID: 653726198280949760

Description:

Dear PharmEasy Customer Support Team,
Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

I am writing this email as a FINAL, URGENT, and HIGH-PRIORITY ESCALATION regarding the severe mishandling and procedural lapses associated with my order Order ID: 653726198280949760.

I request you to read this email completely and carefully, as every point mentioned below is critical and requires immediate senior-level attention.


---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under the above-mentioned order ID.
However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items,

And both items were wrong/incorrect medicines,

The remaining 3 items were completely missing.


This is not a minor operational error. This is a serious breach of order integrity, especially in the pharmaceutical industry where accuracy directly affects customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed because your team reviewed only the dispatch video and found no issue.

With due respect, I want to make it very clear that:

A dispatch-level video alone does NOT constitute a complete investigation.

A standard and fair investigation for missing or incorrect medicines must include:

Review of CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Detailed chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparison at every point

Verification of movement and scan logs

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging or re-routing investigation


Closing a serious complaint based only on the dispatch video is operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request PharmEasy to conduct a complete and transparent chain-of-custody investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

You must review the CCTV footage of:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

Every transit and routing hub

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting area

Pick-up and handover section


B. Verification of Weight Logs

A detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at the origin

Weight during each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


Any mismatch will clearly show missing items.

C. Movement & Scan Audit

A full audit should include:

Outbound scan

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scan

Re-scan or re-routing logs



---

4. Request for Transparency – Provide Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that the relevant CCTV footage, including:

Packing

Sorting

Hub movement

Delivery station handling


be shared with me for transparency, as I have every right to verify how my parcel was handled at each stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving:

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

Provide all the correct medicines/products that I originally ordered.

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Initiating a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all hub CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability through internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety, accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan 


Disclaimer:
This email contains proprietary, business-confidential, and/or privileged material. The information contained in this e-mail is intended solely for the use of the individual to whom it is addressed. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution or action in relation to the contents of this email is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful and request you to permanently delete this message and any attachments herein. You are requested to advise the sender, of your receipt of this email by return e-mail. The Company and its affiliates rule out any and every liability resulting from this or any other electronic transmission.

Pick-up and handover section


B. Verification of Weight Logs

C. Movement & Scan Audit

---

Packing

Sorting

Hub movement

Delivery station handling


be shared with me for transparency, as I have every right to verify how my parcel was handled at each stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving:

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

Provide all the correct medicines/products that I originally ordered.

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Initiating a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all hub CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability through internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety, accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan

Merged from ticket 22273032

Subject: FINAL & MOST CRITICAL ESCALATION – Request for Complete Chain-of-Custody Audit, Full Multi-Hub CCTV Verification & Immediate Resolution | Order ID: 653726198280949760

Description:

Dear PharmEasy Customer Support Team,
Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

I am writing this email as a FINAL, URGENT, and HIGH-PRIORITY ESCALATION regarding the severe mishandling and procedural lapses associated with my order Order ID: 653726198280949760.

I request you to read this email completely and carefully, as every point mentioned below is critical and requires immediate senior-level attention.


---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under the above-mentioned order ID.
However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items,

And both items were wrong/incorrect medicines,

The remaining 3 items were completely missing.


This is not a minor operational error. This is a serious breach of order integrity, especially in the pharmaceutical industry where accuracy directly affects customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed because your team reviewed only the dispatch video and found no issue.

With due respect, I want to make it very clear that:

A dispatch-level video alone does NOT constitute a complete investigation.

A standard and fair investigation for missing or incorrect medicines must include:

Review of CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Detailed chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparison at every point

Verification of movement and scan logs

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging or re-routing investigation


Closing a serious complaint based only on the dispatch video is operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request PharmEasy to conduct a complete and transparent chain-of-custody investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

You must review the CCTV footage of:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

Every transit and routing hub

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting area

Pick-up and handover section


B. Verification of Weight Logs

A detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at the origin

Weight during each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


Any mismatch will clearly show missing items.

C. Movement & Scan Audit

A full audit should include:

Outbound scan

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scan

Re-scan or re-routing logs



---

4. Request for Transparency – Provide Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that the relevant CCTV footage, including:

Packing

Sorting

Hub movement

Delivery station handling


be shared with me for transparency, as I have every right to verify how my parcel was handled at each stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving:

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

Provide all the correct medicines/products that I originally ordered.

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Initiating a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all hub CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability through internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety, accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan

This email contains proprietary, business-confidential, and/or privileged material. The information contained in this e-mail is intended solely for the use of the individual to whom it is addressed. The Company and its affiliates rule out any and every liability resulting from this or any other electronic transmission.

Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under this order ID.

However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items

Both items were wrong/incorrect medicines

The remaining 3 items were completely missing


This is not a minor operational error. In the pharmaceutical industry, such mistakes are a serious breach of safety and accuracy, directly affecting customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed after reviewing only the dispatch video.

With due respect, I must state clearly:

A dispatch-level video alone is NOT a complete investigation.

A proper investigation requires:

CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Full chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparisons at every stage

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging and re-routing checks

Complete audit of all scan and movement logs


Closing a serious medicine-related complaint solely based on the dispatch video is operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request a complete and transparent multi-hub investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

Footage from:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

All transit and routing hubs

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting & handover area


B. Verification of Weight Logs

Detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at origin

Weight at each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


C. Movement & Scan Audit

Full audit of:

Outbound scans

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scans

Re-scan and re-routing logs



---

4. Transparency – Share Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that all relevant CCTV footage, including packing, sorting, hub movement, and delivery station handling, be shared with me for transparency. I have the full right to verify how my parcel was handled at every stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving wrong items, missing items, and incorrect quantity clearly indicates:

Parcel mishandling during transit

Incorrect sorting or packing

Misrouting at a hub

Tampering or misplacement


Only a multi-hub, multi-stage investigation can identify the exact point of failure.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Given the seriousness of this issue, I expect one of the following resolutions immediately:

✔ Option 1: Replacement – Provide all the correct medicines/products originally ordered
OR
✔ Option 2: Full Refund – For all missing and incorrect items

A fair, customer-centric resolution is mandatory.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Conducting a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all relevant CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs and scan logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability across internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

If this complaint is again closed without:

Complete CCTV review

Proper multi-hub investigation

Transparent, justified resolution


I will escalate the matter to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant pharmaceutical regulatory authorities

Any other legal forum as applicable


I hope PharmEasy resolves this matter immediately before external escalation becomes necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of:

Accuracy

Safety

Transparency

Operational integrity


All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)



---

Final Statement (as requested):

You have wasted more than 10 days of my time on this issue. I cannot allow any further delay. I expect a suitable resolution to be provided immediately — without any further delay.


---

Warm regards,
Rohan

Merged from ticket 22275663

Subject: FINAL URGENT ESCALATION – Missing & Wrong Medicines Delivered | Immediate Resolution Required | Order ID: 653726198280949760

Description:
Dear PharmEasy Customer Support Team,
Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

I am writing this email as a FINAL, URGENT, and HIGH-PRIORITY ESCALATION regarding the severe mishandling and procedural lapses associated with my order Order ID: 653726198280949760.

Please read this email carefully and completely, as every point mentioned below is critical and requires immediate senior-level intervention.


---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under this order ID.

However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items

Both items were wrong/incorrect medicines

The remaining 3 items were completely missing


This is not a minor operational error. In the pharmaceutical industry, such mistakes are a serious breach of safety and accuracy, directly affecting customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed after reviewing only the dispatch video.

With due respect, I must state clearly:

A dispatch-level video alone is NOT a complete investigation.

A proper investigation requires:

CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Full chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparisons at every stage

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging and re-routing checks

Complete audit of all scan and movement logs


Closing a serious medicine-related complaint solely based on the dispatch video is operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request a complete and transparent multi-hub investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

Footage from:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

All transit and routing hubs

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting & handover area


B. Verification of Weight Logs

Detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at origin

Weight at each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


C. Movement & Scan Audit

Full audit of:

Outbound scans

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scans

Re-scan and re-routing logs



---

4. Transparency – Share Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that all relevant CCTV footage, including packing, sorting, hub movement, and delivery station handling, be shared with me for transparency. I have the full right to verify how my parcel was handled at every stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving wrong items, missing items, and incorrect quantity clearly indicates:

Parcel mishandling during transit

Incorrect sorting or packing

Misrouting at a hub

Tampering or misplacement


Only a multi-hub, multi-stage investigation can identify the exact point of failure.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Given the seriousness of this issue, I expect one of the following resolutions immediately:

✔ Option 1: Replacement – Provide all the correct medicines/products originally ordered
OR
✔ Option 2: Full Refund – For all missing and incorrect items

A fair, customer-centric resolution is mandatory.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Conducting a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all relevant CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs and scan logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability across internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

If this complaint is again closed without:

Complete CCTV review

Proper multi-hub investigation

Transparent, justified resolution


I will escalate the matter to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant pharmaceutical regulatory authorities

Any other legal forum as applicable


I hope PharmEasy resolves this matter immediately before external escalation becomes necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of:

Accuracy

Safety

Transparency

Operational integrity


All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)



---

Final Statement (as requested):

You have wasted more than 10 days of my time on this issue. I cannot allow any further delay. I expect a suitable resolution to be provided immediately — without any further delay.


---

Warm regards,
Rohan

notes.body: Hello Rohan,    Greetings from PharmEasy!  Pursuant to your conversation with our Escalations team, as an exception, a refund of Rs. 884.92 was initiated to your account today. Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this.      Rs. 1931.89 is credited to your PharmEasy wallet. To check your PharmEasy Wallet balance, go to the accounts section and click on the Wallet section to see the balance amount. This amount does not have an expiry, and you can use the same in your next order.      A Promotional discount of Rs. 100 was also credited to your PharmEasy wallet. To check your PharmEasy Wallet balance, go to the accounts section and click on the Wallet section to see the balance amount and expiry date.   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.  Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.  Regards, Grievance Officer HelpDesk.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.

Grievance Officer HelpDesk.

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

or

Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.

the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

and incorrect items.

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety,
accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare
products.

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves

Rohan

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety,
accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare
products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves
and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan

helpdesk_ticket.subject: FINAL & MOST CRITICAL ESCALATION – Request for Complete Chain-of-Custody Audit, Full Multi-Hub CCTV Verification & Immediate Resolution | Order ID: 653726198280949760
helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
Dear PharmEasy Customer Support Team,
Grievance Redressal Department,
and Senior Management,

I am writing this email as a FINAL, URGENT, and HIGH-PRIORITY ESCALATION regarding the severe mishandling and procedural lapses associated with my order Order ID: 653726198280949760.

I request you to read this email completely and carefully, as every point mentioned below is critical and requires immediate senior-level attention.


---

1. Summary of the Issue – Missing and Wrong Medicines

I had ordered 5 medicines/products under the above-mentioned order ID.
However, during delivery:

I received only 2 items,

And both items were wrong/incorrect medicines,

The remaining 3 items were completely missing.


This is not a minor operational error. This is a serious breach of order integrity, especially in the pharmaceutical industry where accuracy directly affects customer health and safety.


---

2. Incomplete and Procedurally Incorrect Investigation

I was informed that my complaint was closed because your team reviewed only the dispatch video and found no issue.

With due respect, I want to make it very clear that:

A dispatch-level video alone does NOT constitute a complete investigation.

A standard and fair investigation for missing or incorrect medicines must include:

Review of CCTV footage from all hubs

Transit-level verification of the parcel

Sorting-center camera checks

Detailed chain-of-custody tracking

Weight log comparison at every point

Verification of movement and scan logs

Delivery station handover footage

Re-bagging or re-routing investigation


Closing a serious complaint based only on the dispatch video is operationally incomplete, logically insufficient, and professionally unacceptable.


---

3. Request for Full Chain-of-Custody Investigation

I formally request PharmEasy to conduct a complete and transparent chain-of-custody investigation, including:

A. CCTV Footage Review (Mandatory)

You must review the CCTV footage of:

Packing center

First sorting warehouse

Every transit and routing hub

Regional processing centers

Final delivery hub

Delivery station sorting area

Pick-up and handover section


B. Verification of Weight Logs

A detailed comparison of:

Initial package weight at the origin

Weight during each hub scan

Weight during re-bagging

Final delivery station weight


Any mismatch will clearly show missing items.

C. Movement & Scan Audit

A full audit should include:

Outbound scan

Inbound scans at all hubs

Routing details

Sorting belt entries

Delivery executive pickup scan

Re-scan or re-routing logs



---

4. Request for Transparency – Provide Relevant CCTV Footage

Once the investigation is completed, I request that the relevant CCTV footage, including:

Packing

Sorting

Hub movement

Delivery station handling


be shared with me for transparency, as I have every right to verify how my parcel was handled at each stage.


---

5. Strong Red Flags Indicating Mishandling

Receiving:

Wrong items,

Missing items,

Incorrect delivery quantity,


clearly indicates that:

The parcel was either mishandled during transit,
or

Incorrectly sorted or packed,
or

Misrouted at a particular hub,
or

Tampered with or misplaced during the chain movement.


Only a thorough multi-hub investigation can find the exact failure point.


---

6. Immediate and Suitable Resolution Expected

Considering the severity of the issue, I expect PharmEasy to provide one of the following resolutions:

✔ Option 1: Replacement

Provide all the correct medicines/products that I originally ordered.

✔ Option 2: Full Refund

If replacement is not possible, initiate a complete refund for all missing and incorrect items.

A fair and customer-centric resolution is expected and required.


---

7. Urgent Actions Required

Please proceed with:

1. Reopening my complaint


2. Initiating a multi-hub chain-of-custody audit


3. Reviewing all hub CCTV footage


4. Verifying weight logs


5. Sharing relevant CCTV footage with me


6. Providing either replacement or refund


7. Ensuring accountability through internal teams




---

8. Final Warning Before External Escalation

I want to state clearly, respectfully, and firmly:

If this complaint is again closed without:

A complete CCTV review,

A full chain-of-custody audit,

A transparent and justified resolution,


I will be left with no choice but to escalate this matter further to:

PharmEasy Senior Executive Leadership

National Consumer Helpline (Government of India)

Consumer Court under Consumer Protection Act, 2019

Relevant Pharmaceutical Regulatory Authorities

Any other legal body as applicable


I hope PharmEasy will resolve the matter before such steps become necessary.


---

9. Conclusion

PharmEasy is expected to maintain the highest standards of safety, accuracy, and transparency, especially when dealing with healthcare products.

All I seek is:

A complete and professional investigation

Transparent communication

A fair resolution (replacement or refund)


I trust your team will handle this matter with the seriousness it deserves and respond urgently.

Warm regards,
Rohan
